Uses of Class
progassign1.Vertex

    • Uses of Vertex in progassign1

      Methods in progassign1 that return Vertex 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Vertex MST.getBestNode()
      The getBestNode method returns the node within the MST that has the shortest edge attached to it.
      Vertex Vertex.getClosest()
      The getClosest method determines and returns the vertex to which this vertex is closest based on edge weight.
      Methods in progassign1 that return types with arguments of type Vertex 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> Vertex.getConnectedVertices()
      The getConnectedVertices is a simple accessor for the connectedVertices field.
      Methods in progassign1 with parameters of type Vertex 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void MST.addNode(Vertex v)
      The addNode method adds a vertex to the minimum spanning tree and ensures that a node already contained in the MST cannot be redundantly added to it.
      boolean Vertex.equals(Vertex v)
      The equals method checks to see if this vertex is the same as another one buy seeing if they have the same coordinates.
      double Vertex.getEdgeWeight(Vertex otherVertex)
      The getEdgeWeight method determines the Euclidean distance between this vertex and a specified other vertex.
      void Vertex.removeConnection(Vertex v)
      The removeConnection method removes a specified vertex from the list of vertices to which this vertex is connected.
      Method parameters in progassign1 with type arguments of type Vertex 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Vertex.makeConnections(java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> graph)
      The makeConnections method connects this vertex with all other vertexes in the given ArrayList of vertices.
      Constructors in progassign1 with parameters of type Vertex 
      Constructor and Description
      MST(Vertex first)
      The constructor takes a single Vertex to be the beginning of the MST.
